comment: Fruit and spice notes on the nose. Initial fruit followed by sweetness and vanilla on the palate. Short soft aftertaste. Very nice Canadian whiskey @ $39.95 in the lcbo
Sadly theirs just not much to it. Very light and bland.  That said,  I’ve been tasting some heavy scotches this week so I’ll give it another chance....or two.
Huge sasparilla and powdered sugar followed by immature alcohol burn and dominant woody bitterness. I've had worse but will probably never buy again.
Sweet raw oak and cream soda vanilla. Decent but I wish the raw oak was aged out. Basically a more refined Dillon’s Rye. Still not one I’d buy. $35 in Ontario.

Nose: Fruity (mix of dark and tart berries; cranberries, plum, raspberry), sherry, dried fruit ( old raisins), black tea, candied fruits (apple), caramel apple, grapefruit, herbal grassy notes and a hint of rich tobacco, old oak, red liquorice, werthers original caramel, hops skunkiness, rye fruitiness and spiciness (spicy cinnamon on tangy apples), pine tree, a light and smooth liquor infused caramel (a la crown royal), a good dose of malty milk chocolate (a high quality creamy hot cocoa mix), very light rubbery/leather note, chalky chocolate, hint of strawberry and blueberry marmalade, bit of a chlorine and pleasantly sweet chemical scent, sweet mint, candied oranges 

Palate: Candied orange, old oak, rye fruits (ripe yet tangy red apples, cherries, red grapes, also semi sweet strawberry), mixed ground peppercorns, red liquorice, black tea, hint of vanilla, cinnamon and paprika light spiciness, mild sugar syrup and honey dense sweetness

Finish: Very pleasant red apple sweetness, oak and rye spice bitterness, dry oak woodiness, a hint of apple and strawberry jam
Kind of sharp, not enough depth in flavour.

Not sure how i feel about this one.   One of the strangest tasting whiskys I've ever tasted.  To me it has two distinct  notes, which are pepper  and vanilla.  STRONG vanilla.   More than I've  ever tasted in a whisky before.   I gave it a 3 because  sometimes I really  enjoy it and other times its  just  too different and overly  sweet on the nose.   That being said  I think it's  really  great to have the option  of a whisky that tastes  like this.  It adds to the growing  number of completely unique and high  quality  Canadian spirits.

There is something quite different about this blend. 

Just about a 4.0 for me.

$34.95 in Ontario
Sweet, creamy mouth feel. Very high vanilla and then transitioning to something quite sweet as a finish.

This is a very good value in Canadian whiskey.  I love the balance between the sweetness of the barley malt and the spice of the rye, with corn in the background rounding things out.  This is my go-to everyday Canadian whisky.
